New Records: James Rodríguez tied Falcao García's mark of 13 goals in World Cup qualifiers with his penalty goal.
Colombia maintained an unbeaten streak in South American World Cup qualifying.
Key Match Events: Yerson Mosquera opened the scoring with a header from James Rodríguez's cross in the 25th minute.
Nicolás González capitalized on a defensive error to equalize for Argentina in the 48th minute.
James Rodríguez scored a penalty in the 60th minute to give Colombia the lead and secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was a Copa América final rematch, with Argentina having defeated Colombia 1-0 in extra time last July.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina leads the South American World Cup qualifying standings with 18 points, two points ahead of Colombia.
Colombia's victory marked their first win over Argentina since 2019.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Metropolitano Roberto Meléndez stadium in Barranquilla, Colombia.
The game featured a line of COL -0.5 and an over/under of 1.5.
